problem: clear cache / temporary files / system cleanup

solutions.description: Run Disk Cleanup with all options to clear system cache and temporary files.
Delete all temporary files from user temp directory.
Clear browser temporary internet files and cache.
Clear DNS resolver cache to fix network issues.
Clear system file cache and verify integrity of system files.
Restart Windows Explorer, which often fixes flickering.
Restart Desktop Window Manager to reset display pipeline.
Open System Configuration to check startup items or drivers causing flicker.
Reset network stack and renew IP address.
Clear DNS cache to resolve name resolution problems.
Check WLAN AutoConfig service is running.
Repair corrupted system files.
Repair boot records if Windows fails to start.
Scan and fix disk errors that block booting.
List running processes to identify heavy apps.
Kill Chrome if it consumes excessive memory.
Open Disk Cleanup to free up space.
Repair file system issues.
Fix corrupted system files.
Repair system image corruption.
Repair drivers/system image.
Open sound settings to set default playback device.
Reinstall/update audio drivers.
Update/reinstall USB controller drivers.
Disable USB selective suspend in power options.
Restart system fully to reload USB stack.

solutions.command: net stop spooler && net start spooler
solutions.description: Restart print spooler service.
Open Devices and Printers to set default printer.
Restart spooler process directly if stuck.
Fix corrupted keyboard drivers.
Reinstall keyboard driver.
Use on-screen keyboard to confirm hardware/software issue.

problem: mouse cursor not moving / frozen touchpad

solutions.description: Update/reinstall touchpad or mouse drivers.
Open Mouse Properties to adjust settings.
Check startup programs that may disable touchpad.

solutions.command: net stop wuauserv && net stop cryptsvc && net stop bits && net stop msiserver
solutions.description: Stop Windows Update services to reset update components.
Rename SoftwareDistribution folder to clear update cache.

solutions.command: net start wuauserv && net start cryptsvc && net start bits && net start msiserver
solutions.description: Restart Windows Update services after clearing cache.
Take ownership of files or folders recursively.
Grant full permissions to current user for file/folder.
Remove read-only, system, and hidden attributes from files.
Configure Disk Cleanup with advanced options.
Delete temporary files older than 7 days.
Delete all system restore points to free space.
Scan and repair system files including registry.
Check Windows image for registry corruption.
Check disk for bad sectors that may corrupt registry.

solutions.command: net stop "Windows Search" && net start "Windows Search"
solutions.description: Restart Windows Search service.
Open Indexing Options to rebuild search index.
Check for corrupted search components.
Restart Windows Explorer to fix taskbar issues.
Re-register Windows apps that may be causing taskbar issues.
Repair system files that may affect taskbar functionality.
Re-register Shell Experience Host for Start Menu.
Re-register Cortana package that affects Start Menu.
Repair Windows image corruption affecting Start Menu.
Identify processes consuming high CPU resources.
Disable hibernation to reduce background CPU usage.
Disable unnecessary startup programs causing high CPU.
Reset Windows activation grace period.
Attempt to activate Windows online.
Display detailed license information for troubleshooting.
Create new user account to test profile corruption.
Repair system files that may affect user profiles.
Repair Windows image corruption affecting profiles.
Set Windows Defender service to start automatically.
Start Windows Defender service manually.
Enable real-time protection in Windows Defender.
Force synchronization with time server.

solutions.command: net stop w32time && net start w32time
solutions.description: Restart Windows Time service.
Re-register Windows Time service.
Clear DNS resolver cache.

solutions.command: netsh int ip set dns "Wi-Fi" static 8.8.8.8
solutions.description: Set DNS server to Google's public DNS.
Test DNS resolution to verify connectivity.

solutions.command: netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="AppName" dir=in action=allow program="C:\path\to\app.exe"
solutions.description: Add firewall exception for specific application.

solutions.command: netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state off
solutions.description: Temporarily disable Windows Firewall for testing.
Open Windows Firewall settings GUI.
Scan and repair corrupted system files.
Repair Windows component store corruption.
Check and repair file system errors on system drive.
Open Bluetooth settings to toggle and re-pair devices.
Ensure Bluetooth Support Service is running.
Update/reinstall Bluetooth drivers in Device Manager.
Allow camera access in privacy settings.
Update/reinstall camera drivers in Device Manager.
Check device detection in DirectX Diagnostic Tool.
Allow microphone access in privacy settings.
Open sound settings to set default recording device.
Update/reinstall microphone drivers in Device Manager.

problem: windows store not working / apps not downloading

solutions.description: Reset Microsoft Store cache.
Open Apps & features to repair or reset the Store app.
Re-register Microsoft Store app.
Restart File Explorer process.
Repair system files that may affect Explorer.
Free up disk space that may impact Explorer stability.

problem: external monitor not detected / second screen

solutions.description: Open display settings to detect and configure monitors.
Toggle display modes (PC only, duplicate, extend).
Update display adapter drivers in Device Manager.

problem: battery not charging / battery draining fast

solutions.description: Generate a battery health report.
Open power options to adjust power plan.
Reinstall battery drivers in Device Manager.
Check Application logs for crash details.
Repair system files that may cause app crashes.
Repair Windows image corruption affecting apps.
